result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Daley Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald Daley Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronald Daley Jones was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by DOC.    Due/paid by the end of probation in 14CM3223.  Court found the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  
DNA sample, pay the surcharge.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Daley Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered charge dismissed.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 90 days time served.  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections; due paid by the end of probation in 14CM3223.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  DNA sample, pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Ronald Daley Jones in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Defendant Ronald Daley Jones in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancers, Repeater and Use of a Dangerous Weapon dismissed.
from the state received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  rmm

Defendant Ronald Daley Jones in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Defendant Ronald Daley Jones in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case recalled.  The alleged victim has not been brought in to court yet.  Court ordered matter adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to appear at the 10/19/15 jury trial at 8:30 am.

Defendant Ronald Daley Jones not in court, defendant in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.

Defendant Ronald Daley Jones in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Defendant Ronald Daley Jones in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court having been advised that witness, Laverne L. had been subpoenaed and served.  Court ordered that a bench warrant be issued for the defaulting witness.  Case passed to 1:30 pm.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing JULY 21, 2015 received and filed. (15 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ERIC LOWENBERG  16655 W. BLUEMOUND RD. STE. 190    BROOKFIELD, WI 53005
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Ronald Daley Jones in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 9/21/15 in Branch 40.  State put the offer on the record and will hold it open until 9/16/15.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.


Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-09-2015 at 08:30 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 09-21-2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg in court, defendant Ronald Daley Jones not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has three cases before the court.
Demand for Speedy Trial was entered on 07-21-2015.
State's request to join cases for trial; no objection by defense counsel.  Court orders cases joined for trial and case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Ronald Daley Jones in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Defendant Ronald Daley Jones in custody.  Sarra Kiaie for Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Kurt Meyle-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference and Bail/Bond Hearing are scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Laverne L or her child

Defendant Ronald Daley Jones in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ronald Daley Jones in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Plea WITHHELD as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
